definition: peer/member of the same class, generation or social group

sentences.english: Peer review will need to be peer pressure.
sentences.chinese: 同侪评审需要深化为同侪压力。

sentences.english: Peer review will need to be peer pressure.
sentences.chinese: 同侪评审需要深化为同侪压力。

sentences.english: The boy was rejected by his peers due to his coarseness.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩子因为很粗鲁被同侪排挤。

sentences.english: It becomes much more of a peer-based marketing and image.
sentences.chinese: 资讯科技一个以同侪为基础的行销和图像变得更加多。

sentences.english: No studies assessing the impact of peer review on the quality of funded research are presently available.
sentences.chinese: 目前没有关于同侪审查对所资助的研究品质的证据。

sentences.english: Second, we checked to see if they have significant financial resources relative to their peers.
sentences.chinese: 第二，我们看较之同侪，他们是否有显著的资金来源。

sentences.english: The positive function of peer review in teaching foreign language writing is well recognized.
sentences.chinese: 同侪校阅在写作教学中的积极作用得到了普遍认可。

definition: to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
outstanding talent (idiom)/incomparable artistic merit/accomplishment out of the ordinary
to make reference to/to write about
to hope to reach/to strive for
not more than so-so (idiom); mediocre/nothing out of the ordinary
out of the ordinary/unusually (good, talented etc)
to be shoulder to shoulder/to be on an equal level with/Taiwan pr. [bi4 jian1]
